snippet: The Broadway producers of “The Audience,” with Helen Mirren as Queen Elizabeth II, have turned down $400,000 to let “It’s Only a Play” continue in the Schoenfeld Theater.
abstract: Broadway producers of The Audience, upcoming play starring Helen Mirren, have turned down $400,000 from rival producers who want to continue record-breaking run of It's Only a Play at the palatial Schoenfeld Theater in 2015; jockeying reflects imperative of producers and directors to hold fast to a prime Broadway theater once it finally comes their way.
lead_paragraph: The Broadway producers of “The Audience,” with Helen Mirren as Queen Elizabeth II, have turned down $400,000 to let “It’s Only a Play” continue in the Schoenfeld Theater.

headline.seo: Producers of ‘The Audience,’ With Helen Mirren, Won’t Move
headline.main: Why the Theater Next Door Isn’t Fit for a Queen
headline.print_headline: Why the Theater Next Door Isn’t Fit for a Queen
